general purpose client work ‘OAI-PMH’ service. ‘OAI-PMH’ protocol described http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html. main functions follow OAI-PMH verbs: GetRecord Identify ListIdentifiers ListMetadataFormats ListRecords ListSets
Install CRAN install development version GitHub Load oai
code: install.packages("oai") devtools::install_github("ropensci/oai") library("oai")

id("http://oai.datacite.org/oai") #>   repositoryName                      baseURL protocolVersion #> 1   DataCite MDS https://oai.datacite.org/oai             2.0 #>             adminEmail    earliestDatestamp deletedRecord #> 1 support@datacite.org 2011-01-01T00:00:00Z    persistent #>            granularity compression compression.1 #> 1 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ        gzip       deflate #>                                      description #> 1 oaioai.datacite.org:oai:oai.datacite.org:12425

code: @Manual{,   title = {oai: General Purpose 'Oai-PMH' Services Client},   author = {Scott Chamberlain and Michal Bojanowski},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.4.1, https://github.com/ropensci/oai},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/oai/}, }

title: General Purpose Oai-PMH Services Client
text: oai R client work OAI-PMH (Open Archives Initiative Protocol Metadata Harvesting) services, protocol developed Open Archives Initiative (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_Archives_Initiative). OAI-PMH uses XML data format transported HTTP. OAI-PMH Info: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_Archives_Initiative_Protocol_for_Metadata_Harvesting) OAI V2 specification (http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html) oai built xml2 httr. addition, give back data.frame’s whenever possible make data comprehension, manipulation, visualization easier. also functions fetch large directory OAI-PMH services - isn’t exhaustive, contain lot. OAI-PMH instead paging e.g., page per_page parameters, uses (optionally) resumptionTokens, optionally expiration date. tokens can used continue next chunk data, first request get end. Often, OAI-PMH services limit request 50 records, may vary provider, don’t know sure. API package loop internally get records. may future expose e.g., limit parameter can say many records want, haven’t done yet.

what: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
title: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
text: Count OAI-PMH identifiers data provider.

title: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
code: count_identifiers(url = "http://export.arxiv.org/oai2", prefix = "oai_dc", ...)

title: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
text: url (character) OAI-PMH base url. Defaults URL arXiv's OAI-PMH server (http://export.arxiv.org/oai2) GBIF's OAI-PMH server (http://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry) prefix Specifies metadata format records returned ... Curl options passed GET

title: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
text: Note OAI providers include entry completeListSize (http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html#FlowControl) case return NA - mean 0, rather know.

title: Count OAI-PMH identifiers for a data provider. — count_identifiers
code: if (FALSE) { count_identifiers()  # curl options # library("httr") # count_identifiers(config = verbose()) }

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
text: Result dumpers functions allowing handle chunks results OAI-PMH service "fly". Handling can include processing, writing files, databases etc.

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
code: dump_raw_to_txt(   res,   args,   as,   file_pattern = "oaidump",   file_dir = ".",   file_ext = ".xml" )  dump_to_rds(   res,   args,   as,   file_pattern = "oaidump",   file_dir = ".",   file_ext = ".rds" )  dump_raw_to_db(res, args, as, dbcon, table_name, field_name, ...)

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
text: res results, depends , specified user args list, query arguments, specified user character, type result return, specified user file_pattern, file_dir, file_ext character respectively: initial part file name, directory name, file extension used create file names. arguments passed tempfile() arguments pattern, tmpdir, fileext respectively. dbcon DBI-compliant database connection table_name character, name database table write field_name character, name field database table write ... arguments passed /functions

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
text: Dumpers return NULL value collected returned function using dumper. dump_raw_to_txt returns name created file. dump_to_rds returns name created file. dump_xml_to_db returns NULL

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
text: Often result request OAI-PMH service large split chunks need requested separately using resumptionToken. default functions like list_identifiers() list_records() request chunks hood return concatenated single R object. convenient insufficient dealing large result sets might fit RAM. result dumper function called result chunk. Dumper functions can write chunks files databases, include initial pre-processing extraction, . result dumper needs function accepts least arguments: res, args, . get values enclosing function internally. may additional arguments, including .... Dumpers return NULL value collected returned function calling dumper (e.g. list_records()). Currently result dumpers can used functions: list_identifiers(), list_records(), list_sets(). use dumper one functions need : Pass additional argument dumper Pass optional addtional arguments dumper function list dumper_args argument See Examples. provide details dumpers currently implemented. dump_raw_to_txt writes raw XML text files. requires =="raw". File names created using tempfile(). default written current working directory format oaidump*.xml * random string hex. dump_to_rds saves results .rds file via saveRDS(). Type object saved determined argument. File names generated way dump_raw_to_txt, default extension .rds dump_xml_to_db writes raw XML single text column table database. Requires == "raw". Database connection dbcon connection object created DBI::dbConnect() package DBI. , can connect database supported DBI. records written field field_name table table_name using DBI::dbWriteTable(). table exist, created. , records appended. additional arguments passed DBI::dbWriteTable()

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
text: OAI-PMH specification https://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html

title: Result dumpers — dumpers
code: if (FALSE) {  ### Dumping raw XML to text files  # This will write a set of XML files to a temporary directory fnames <- list_identifiers(from="2018-06-01T",                            until="2018-06-14T",                            as="raw",                            dumper=dump_raw_to_txt,                            dumper_args=list(file_dir=tempdir())) # vector of file names created str(fnames) all( file.exists(fnames) ) # clean-up unlink(fnames)   ### Dumping raw XML to a database  # Connect to in-memory SQLite database con <- DBI::dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), dbname=":memory:") # Harvest and dump the results into field "bar" of table "foo" list_identifiers(from="2018-06-01T",                  until="2018-06-14T",                  as="raw",                  dumper=dump_raw_to_db,                  dumper_args=list(dbcon=con,                                   table_name="foo",                                   field_name="bar") ) # Count records, should be 101 DBI::dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT count(*) as no_records FROM foo")  DBI::dbDisconnect(con)     }

title: Get records — get_records
text: Get records

title: Get records — get_records
code: get_records(   ids,   prefix = "oai_dc",   url = "http://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry",   as = "parsed",   ... )

title: Get records — get_records
text: ids OAI-PMH identifier record. One . Required. prefix specifies metadata format records returned . Default: oai_dc url (character) OAI-PMH base url. Defaults URL arXiv's OAI-PMH server (http://export.arxiv.org/oai2) GBIF's OAI-PMH server (http://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry) (character) return. One "parsed" (default), "raw" (raw text) ... Curl options passed GET

title: Get records — get_records
text: named list data.frame's, lists, raw text

title: Get records — get_records
text: finite set results based OAI prefix. provide parsers time, users express interest. prefix types parsers return list data.frame's, identifier, one data.frame header bits data, one data.frame metadata bits data. prefixes parsers , fall back returning raw XML, can least parse XML . XML nodes duplicated, join values together duplicated node names, separated semicolon (;) spaces. can seprarate easily.

title: Get records — get_records
code: if (FALSE) { get_records("87832186-00ea-44dd-a6bf-c2896c4d09b4")  ids <- c("87832186-00ea-44dd-a6bf-c2896c4d09b4",    "d981c07d-bc43-40a2-be1f-e786e25106ac") (res <- get_records(ids)) lapply(res, "[[", "header") lapply(res, "[[", "metadata") do.call(rbind, lapply(res, "[[", "header")) do.call(rbind, lapply(res, "[[", "metadata"))  # Get raw text get_records("d981c07d-bc43-40a2-be1f-e786e25106ac", as = "raw")  # from arxiv.org get_records("oai:arXiv.org:0704.0001", url = "http://export.arxiv.org/oai2") }

title: List OAI-PMH identifiers — list_identifiers
text: url (character) OAI-PMH base url. Defaults URL arXiv's OAI-PMH server (http://export.arxiv.org/oai2) GBIF's OAI-PMH server (http://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry) prefix Specifies metadata format records returned . specifies records returned must created/update/deleted date. specifies records returned must created/update/deleted date. set specifies set returned records must belong . token token previously provided server resume request last left . (character) return. One "df" (data.frame; default), "list", "raw" (raw text) ... Curl options passed GET

Default: oai_dc specifies records returned must created/update/deleted date. specifies records returned must created/update/deleted date. set specifies set returned records must belong . token (character) token previously provided server resume request last left . 50 max number records returned. loop internally get records asked . (character) return. One "df" (data.frame; default), "list", "raw" (raw text) ... Curl options passed GET

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: oai R client work OAI-PMH (Open Archives Initiative Protocol Metadata Harvesting) services, protocol developed Open Archives Initiative (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_Archives_Initiative). OAI-PMH uses XML data format transported HTTP.

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: See OAI-PMH V2 specification http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/openarchivesprotocol.html

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: oai built xml2 httr. addition, give back data.frame's whenever possible make data comprehension, manipulation, visualization easier. also functions fetch large directory OAI-PMH services - exhaustive, contain lot.

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: Instead paging e.g., page per_page parameters, OAI-PMH uses (optionally) resumptionTokens, optional expiration date. tokens can used continue next chunk data, first request get end. Often, OAI-PMH services limit request 50 records, may vary provider, know sure. API package loop internally get records. may future expose e.g., limit parameter can say many records want, done yet.

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: Michal Bojanowski contributions supported (Polish) National Science Center (NCN) grant 2012/07/D/HS6/01971.

title: OAI-PMH Client — oai-package
text: Scott Chamberlain myrmecocystus@gmail.com Michal Bojanowski michal2992@gmail.com

title: oai 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-10

title: oai 0.4.0
text: requests now made using httr::RETRY() rather httr::GET() facilitate retrying delay control etc. Consult documentation ‘httr’ package (#64) @mbojan takes package maintenance @sckott

title: oai 0.4.0
text: update packages test catch ‘cannotDisseminateFormat’ OAI-PMH-level error correctly added package hex logo

title: oai 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-13

title: oai 0.3.2
text: vignette fix, use markdown suggests update readme, use ropensci coc

title: oai 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-07

title: oai 0.3.0
text: id() gains parameter user can ask different outputs (parsed list/data.frame, raw xml/text) (#54) OAI functions changed default url http://api.gbif.org/v1/oai-pmh/registry, count_identifiers() changed ’s default url http://export.arxiv.org/oai2. previous default url Datacite unreliable (often unresponsive)

title: oai 0.3.0
text: add grant information one author (#48) (#49) code conduct urls fixed now using markdown supported documentation (#56) replace tibble::as_data_frame tibble::as_tibble throughout package

title: oai 0.3.0
text: fix update_providers(); html page scrape changed (#57)

title: oai 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2016-11-23

title: oai 0.2.2
text: Added new parsers get_records() specific different OAI prefixes. Currently parsers oai_dc oai_datacite. prefixes don’t parsers return raw XML can parse . (#45)

title: oai 0.2.2
text: Replace xml2::xml_find_one() xml2::xml_find_first() (#39) Update URLs DESCRIPTION file (#43) Using tibble now compact data.frame instead internal methods (#44) parameter get_records() now options parsed raw, replaces df list, raw

title: oai 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-02-06

title: oai 0.2.0
text: set new functions dealing larger data results: dump_raw_to_txt(), dump_to_rds(), dump_raw_to_db(). can used oai functions list_identifiers(), list_sets(), list_records() (#9) (#15) (#21) thanks @mbojan

title: oai 0.2.0
text: Sped tests (#19) Better description OAI protocol DESCRIPTION file (#28) Commented internal functions come (#31) Import plyr rbind.fill() (#32) Including now examples using OAI-PMH GBIF BHL (#33) Better error handling! (#10) (#12) (#22) (#27) thanks @mbojan

title: oai 0.2.0
text: Fixed bug list_identifiers() threw error result found (#13) Dealing better bad inputs parameter - stop informative message now instead failing without anything returned (#34)

title: oai 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2015-09-11 Released CRAN.
